text: Summary: It is complex to view all the html codes in our original python code itself, and this gives rise to the need for importing render_template class from the flask library. We can pass in variables to the html files using {{}}. We have to pass in a second argument in render_template function, as 'name to be used in html = variable in our python file'. In the html file, we can pass in the variable by inserting name in the double curly braes. Values generated from our dictionary will be accessed through '.key' format. We can also make codes using {%%}. Unlike our loops and conditionals in python, html codes has to be ended manually by using statements such as {% endif %} or {% endfor %}. This system is somehow similar to the C++ language.   We can make one html file inherit from another html file that is in the same directory. The parent file has a block code inside in the format of {% block name %} {% endblock %}. Putting {% extend "layout.html" %} in the first line of the child file is a declaration that we will extend from that parent html file. Simply putting the lines of code that we want between {% block name %} and {% endblock name %} will extend that particular block from the parent html file.   This way of inheriting html file from another is the best practices, because it lets our code stay 'DRY'(don't repeat your self). It makes us easier to debug, lessens time to code, and makes it easier to update our website. Therefore, Corey adds bootstrap operation and some other functions in the layout.html, which is the parent file.
